results.title: My journey
results.creator_credit: Michelle Johnstone, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Dad taught me about photography, cooking, Geelong Football Club and Legacy. Michelle tells of how she joined as a junior legatee and how being a member of legacy has given her the confidence in life and has helped her to become who she is today.

results.title: Music in the woods: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising MUSIC IN THE WOODS, THE ANIMAL GARDEN, WOEFUL AND THE WASPBERRIES, TIDYING TIMOTHY’S BEDROOM and GUMPA SOLVES A JIGSAW PUZZLE. MUSIC IN THE WOODS: Timothy and the special animals spend a day in the woods collecting feathers. As a precaution against any animals getting lost, they take their musical instruments to play if they get lost in the woods. In the woods they meet a new friend, the Parrot, but they soon realise that Little Mut is missing. THE ANIMAL GARDEN: The animals are given their own garden to look after by Timothy. Nothing seems to be growing, until Woeful and Gumpa decide to help things along. WOEFUL AND THE WASPBERRIES: The animals decide to organise a surprise birthday picnic for Timothy and they are all caught up in the preparations, except for Woeful who has forgotten all about Timothy’s birthday. Luckily he has an idea for a present, but it’s an idea that will lead him into all sorts of trouble. TIDYING TIMOTHY’S BEDROOM: When Timothy gets into trouble for having a messy bedroom, the animals decide to surprise him by tidying it themselves. There’s a prize for the first one to finish up, but there are even more surprises in store, especially for Timothy. GUMPA SOLVES A JIGSAW PUZZLE: Timothy and the animals are working on a jigsaw when Timothy is called in for tea. When they resume the puzzle after dinner, they discover a piece missing and the animals must perform a bit of detective work to find the missing piece.
results.title_for_label: Music in the woods: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films

results.title: Stripey to the rescue: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE, GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX, THE TREASURE HUNT, GETUP CRUSOE and KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF. STRIPEY TO THE RESCUE: Timothy’s mother decides that Stripey and Getup are old and dirty and could harm Timothy who is suffering from a cold. She gives them away to a jumble sale but on the way Getup is kidnapped by the circus and meets a mouse called Kinker. GUMPA AND THE PAINTBOX: Gumpa decides that he is unwell when he wakes up one morning and his head is turned around the wrong way. His friends, Timothy and Little Mut come out in sympathy. THE TREASURE HUNT: All of the toys are hunting for treasure after Gumpa finds a mysterious plan. Getup and Stripey look in a tunnel, Little Mut is helped by a squirrel and Woeful from Jick the Jackdaw. With everyone on the case, they are sure to find something. GETUP CRUSOE: The animals are listening to Timothy reading ‘Robinson Crusoe’ but the story in interrupted when Timothy has to go to school. After he has left, Stripey has an idea, Getup has an adventure and Little Mut is very brave. KINKER VISITS THE ANIMAL SHELF: When Stripey and Getup visit Mr Trig’s pet shop with Timothy they find their friend Kinker stuck in a cage. With a little help from Timothy they help him escape and find a new home for him on the animal shelf; Kinker is unhappy however, he wants to go back to his real home.

results.title: Ken's great times with Legacy
results.creator_credit: Ken Hellnig, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Ken joined Legacy after his dad’s death. He went on the first Legacy camp in his early 20s and he shares with us his years with Legacy, the camps, day trips, boating adventures and the friends made over the years.

results.title: In flux
results.creator_credit: Ryan Linfors, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: When Ryan joined Legacy, he was six years old and fatherless. Legacy taught him about acceptance and gave him three close friends. He tells of his relationship with Bec, Bear and Brad and how they have been there for him and have recently helped him in his decision to become a Legacy leader.

results.title: Family
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Cherry, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Rebecca has been involved in various capacities in Legacy since her father died when she was seven. Rebecca talks about the different families in her life, especially the one she has found at Legacy. She has gone from being a Rotary Exchange student to a Legacy leader.

results.title: The Not so solid earth (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: William H Terry, Lothar Wolff and Time-Life Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life Around Us”.
Here we trace one of the most revolutionary findings of this century: the discovery of powerful forces deep within the earth that move continents and shift oceans. Shows how geologists, oceanographers, palaeontologists and mineralogists gather and analyse supporting data for the theory of “continental drift”, the dynamic system which is reshaping the earth’s surface.

results.title: Families and life
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: A letter to her family and future generations, Suzanne tells of her family history, especially of her father and husband in war and how Legacy helped her with her grief and loss and helped her to move forward with her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Suzanne Shaw, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
